metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000805 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Paramiko version 2.4.1, 2.3.2, 2.2.3, 2.1.5, 2.0.8, 1.18.5, 1.17.6 contains a Incorrect Access Control vulnerability in SSH server that can result in RCE. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-paramiko - 2.0.0-1ubuntu1.1
python3-paramiko - 2.0.0-1ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ebarretto> with this issue, they decided to stop supporting versions 1.x mdeslaur> this issue is in the server code, not the client code

criterions.comment: paramiko package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0-1ubuntu1.1').
